mods.abstract: TWENTY DOLLARS REWARD will be paid for the arrest of the Mulatto Boy CYRUS, who ran away on the 7th instant. Said boy is aged about 30 years, bright mulatto, short thick set, wears a goatee, in walking throws himself badly, and his feet out, he has lost one of his front teeth. At the time he left he had a on a red flannel shirt, and blue cottonade pants. He may probably be at work on the Levee. The avove reward will be paid for his arrest and confinement in any of the Jails. Masters of steamboats are warned against employing said boy. ap11 1w J.H. DURRUTY & CO., 241 Julia st., U.S. Bakery.

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
